dict.string: The Eastern oyster, which is a bivalve mollusk, thrives naturally in Connecticut’s rivers and embayments.
Connecticut is unofficially known as the “Nutmeg State,” because sailors returned here from voyages with that spice.
It was in New Haven in 1878 that Alexander Graham Bell set up the first telephone conversation.
The Mountain Laurel is a popular flower that swathes the hills in pink and white, mostly in the spring.
The cathedral of St. Joseph in Hartford is noted for its spectacular stained-glass windows that line the nave.
Samuel Morey invented the internal combustion engine in 1792, which helped the invention of the automobile.
